articles.description: Today's virtual reality systems can create immersive visual experiences, but seldom do they enable users to feel anything—particularly walls, appliances and furniture. A new device developed at Carnegie Mellon University, however, uses multiple strings attach…

articles.title: Samsung’s ‘Bean’ earbuds to launch as Galaxy BudsX - SamMobile
articles.description: Samsung's next pair of wireless earbuds — picturesquely code-named
articles.content: Samsung’s next pair of wireless earbuds  picturesquely code-named “Bean” will likely launch as the Galaxy BudsX, newly sighted IP documentation suggest. The Korean company applied for a trademark on the said moniker on Monday, having submitted the application… [+1321 chars]

articles.title: Samsung's latest 4K and 8K TVs get a vital advantage over their rivals - Express
articles.description: SAMSUNG'S all-new 4K and 8K televisions get an important certification that rivals such as Sony and LG can't match.
articles.content: Samsung has announced that its new 8K and 4K Smart TVs have received official verification that they will not damage your eyes when binge-watching. Underwriters Laboratories (UL), a leading safety science company in the U.S., and Verband Deutscher Elektrotech… [+1550 chars]

articles.author: Adrian Potoroaca
articles.title: Charging a MacBook on the wrong side can lead to noisy fans and lower performance - TechSpot
articles.description: On the official support page, Apple states that you can charge your MacBook Pro using either one of the USB-C ports. However, it turns out that there are a right way and a wrong way to charge your expensive device,…
articles.content:
In brief: By the looks of it, Apple may be having a new Chargegate on its hands. Several users have found their MacBook Pro has a habit of maxing out the CPU and overheating when charging using the left side ports. 
On the official support page, Apple states… [+2105 chars]

articles.author: By Lara Keay For Mailonline
articles.title: Netflix back online across the UK and Europe after 'something went wrong' error message - Daily Mail
articles.description: Netflix users in the UK, France, Belgium, the Netherlands and other European countries were shown the message 'something went wrong' when they tried to sign in. The service is back online.
articles.content:
Netflix is back online after an outage left hundreds of thousands of people across Britain and western Europe unable to watch their favourite shows. 
Users in the UK, France, Belgium, the Netherlands and other European countries were shown the message 'somet… [+1268 chars]

articles.content:
